meanings.definition: Having more twists or turns than something else.
meanings.sent1: The twistier road led us through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster was twistier than the one we rode last week.
meanings.sent3: I got lost on the twistier path, but it was an adventure!
meanings.sent4: Her story became twistier with each new detail she added.
meanings.sent5: The twistier path was like a maze of surprises.

meanings.sent1: The twistier plot of the movie confused me.
meanings.sent2: Her explanation was twistier than I expected.
meanings.sent3: Trying to follow his twistier logic made my head spin.
meanings.sent4: The twistier route to success is often the most rewarding.
meanings.sent5: The twistier the mystery, the more exciting the resolution.

meanings.definition: To become more twisted or tangled.
meanings.sent1: The vines twistier around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: As I pulled, the rope only became twistier.
meanings.sent3: The plot twistier as the story unfolded.
meanings.sent4: Emotions can twistier when faced with difficult decisions.
meanings.sent5: The yarn became twistier as the kitten played with it.
